Hey people! there is a fix that improves the poor performance for ATI/AMD users. Before, I was unable to get more than 20 FPS even with everything low. With the fix, I have everything on High-Amazing and get ~55 FPS.

The trick is in fooling the game into thinking you have nVidia card. Use this utility: http://modsreloaded.com/alternate-d3d9-fix-for-ati-plus-d3d9gen

It's for Fallout: New Vegas but works with Spider-Man as well. Don't use the d3d9.dll file included in the archive. Use the application to generate a new d3d9.dll file, choosing any nVidia card that is close to your real card in performance. Then you simply copy the d3d9.dll file into the game folder.

if you are unable to create a new dll file, try using the one in the archive.

Please note that the dll file will most likely cause the launcher to crash. So you should change your setting in the launcher BEFORE copying the file, exit the launcher, copy the file and then start the game using Game.exe.

Hope that helps!
